text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
BeReferralPrescription 0..*
identifier 0..*IdentifierAn identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available
status 1..1codeCurrent status
Binding: RequestStatus (required)
reasonCurrentStatus 1..1CodeableConceptReason current status
authoredOn 1..1dateTimeWhen this prescription was created
prescriber 1..1Reference()The prescribing healthcare party
co-prescriber 0..*BackboneElementInformation about co prescribers
co-prescriber 1..1Reference()The co-prescriber party
co-prescriberSubstitute 0..1Reference()NIHDI of co prescriber substitute party
status 1..1codeStatus of co prescribing status (to sign, signed or refused)
patient 1..1Reference()The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.
originalRequest 0..1Reference()The original request or prescription triggered this prescription
reason 0..*Reference()The problem (code or reference) that is the main reason for this prescription
intendedProvider 0..*BackboneElementThe intended provider, i.e. who is expected to perform the procedure - a specific person or a speciality
provider 0..*Reference()A reference to the provider party (e.g. a NIHDI number for a healthcare professional, a SSIN or only a displaystring for a non professional caregiver,...)
discipline 1..1CodeableConceptThe required discipline of the provider party
validityPeriod 1..1PeriodPeriod of validity of prescription
executionPeriod 0..1PeriodWhen this prescription is executed, available after start of execution
prescribedService 1..1CodeableConceptWhat is prescribed
resultReceiver 0..*Reference()Parties that shall be informed of the results of the prescription other then the prescriber.
note 0..1AnnotationAdditional text notes about the request.

Documentation for this format

name: BeReferralPrescription
description: Logical model describing the model for the prescription referral. This draft is used in the HL7 Belgian workgroup for referral.

element.definition: Logical model describing the model for the prescription referral. This draft is used in the HL7 Belgian workgroup for referral.

element.short: An identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available
element.definition: An identifier for the ReferralPrescription, e.g. the UHMEP identifier, once available

element.short: Current status
element.definition: Current status

element.short: Reason current status
element.definition: Reason current status

element.definition: When this prescription was created

element.definition: Information about co prescribers

element.definition: NIHDI of co prescriber substitute party

element.definition: Status of co prescribing status (to sign, signed or refused)

element.short: The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.
element.definition: The SSIN of the person for which the referral is prescribed.

element.short: The original request or prescription triggered this prescription
element.definition: The original request or prescription that is the reason for this request - for example when a detailed request is created by a broader request.

element.definition: The problem (code or reference) that is the main reason for this prescription

element.definition: The intended provider, i.e. who is expected to perform the procedure - a specific person or a speciality

element.short: A reference to the provider party (e.g. a NIHDI number for a healthcare professional, a SSIN or only a displaystring for a non professional caregiver,...)
element.definition: A reference to the provider party (e.g. a NIHDI number for a healthcare professional, a SSIN or only a displaystring for a non professional caregiver,...)

element.short: The required discipline of the provider party
element.definition: The required discipline of the provider party

element.short: Period of validity of prescription
element.definition: Period of validity of prescription

element.short: When this prescription is executed, available after start of execution
element.definition: When this prescription is executed, available after start of execution

element.short: What is prescribed
element.definition: What is prescribed

element.definition: Parties that shall be informed of the results of the prescription other then the prescriber.

element.short: Additional text notes about the request.
element.definition: Additional text notes about the request.
